title: How to Apply Vitamin C Serum for Facial Skin Care

steps.title: Do a patch test to check for an allergic reaction.
steps.content: Do a patch test to check for an allergic reaction. Rub 1 drop of the vitamin C serum onto a small patch of your inner wrist. Since the skin is sensitive here, you're more likely to notice a reaction to the vitamin C. Wait 24 hours to see if your skin is irritated or breaks out in a rash. If it doesn't, you can use vitamin C on your face. [1] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source If you do have a reaction to the vitamin C, don't use it as part of your daily skincare routine and mention it to your doctor or dermatologist. If you also use AHAs and BHAs, such as glycolic, salicylic, or lactic acids, wait a few minutes before applying the vitamin C serum or you'll risk irritating your skin.

steps.title: Plan on using the serum in the morning or before bed.
steps.content: Plan on using the serum in the morning or before bed. Because your skin can only absorb so much vitamin C in a day, you only need to apply it once a day. Decide if you'd like to make it part of your morning skincare routine and remember to apply sunscreen after using the serum. If you prefer, apply the serum in the evening before you apply your nighttime moisturizer. [2] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source [3] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Wash your face
steps.content: Wash your face with a gentle cleanser. Splash cool water over your face and rub a coin-sized amount of cleanser evenly across your face. Use your fingertips to gently massage the cleanser into your skin for about 30 seconds. Then, use water to rinse the cleanser off of your face. [4] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Use a cleanser that's designed for your skin type. For example, if you have sensitive skin, use a fragrance-free cleanser that doesn't contain alcohol.

steps.title: Dry your skin and pat toner across your face.
steps.content: Dry your skin and pat toner across your face. Blot your face dry with a clean cloth and then soak a cotton ball in facial toner. Brush the cotton ball evenly across your face, but avoid getting toner around your eyes. Then, let the toner dry before you apply the vitamin C serum. [5] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you have oily skin and use a toner that contains benzoyl peroxide, wait at least 5 minutes before using the serum. Mixing the benzoyl peroxide with vitamin C could prevent the serum from working effectively.

steps.title: Rub 2 to 3 drops of serum onto your face.
steps.content: Rub 2 to 3 drops of serum onto your face. Use the dropper in the bottle of serum to squeeze 2 to 3 drops of vitamin C serum into an open palm. Then, rub the fingers of your other hand into the oil and dab some of it onto your cheeks and forehead. Massage the oil evenly across the rest of your face. [6] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Wait 5 to 10 minutes before applying moisturizer.
steps.content: Wait 5 to 10 minutes before applying moisturizer . Give the vitamin C serum a chance to soak into your skin before you put another skincare product on. Once your skin feels like it's absorbed the serum, gently massage moisturizer across your face. [7] X Research source If you're doing the facial in the morning, consider using a daytime moisturizer that contains SPF to protect your skin.

steps.title: Apply vitamin C with zinc to reduce inflammation that causes acne.
steps.content: Apply vitamin C with zinc to reduce inflammation that causes acne. Use vitamin C serum that also contains zinc once a day to fight bacteria that causes some types of acne. Since vitamin C also has an anti-inflammatory effect, it can soothe your irritated skin. [8] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source For severe facial acne , talk with your dermatologist about microneedling with vitamin C.

steps.title: Protect your skin from sun damage by applying vitamin C and E serum.
steps.content: Protect your skin from sun damage by applying vitamin C and E serum. If you'd like to protect your skin from damaging UV rays, always put sunscreen on your face before going out. Once you're back inside for the day, wash your face and apply vitamin C serum that also contains vitamin E. [9] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source The vitamins help your skin repair itself from sun exposure, which is why you should apply it after being exposed to UV rays.

steps.title: Add the serum as part of a skincare anti-aging routine.
steps.content: Add the serum as part of a skincare anti-aging routine. You've probably seen anti-aging skincare products that claim to increase collagen. Researchers found that applying vitamin C once a day can actually increase collagen production, a protein which helps your skin repair itself and minimalize wrinkles. [10] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source You'll need to use the vitamin C for at least a few months before you can expect to see an improvement in your skin's appearance.

steps.title: Use vitamin C serum to reduce hyperpigmentation.
steps.content: Use vitamin C serum to reduce hyperpigmentation . Sun exposure or pregnancy can cause noticeable dark patches to appear on your face. Apply vitamin C serum once a day to reduce the pigment that causes the dark patches to appear. [11] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Keep in mind that you'll need to use the serum for at least 3 or 4 months before you might notice an improvement.
